dataset.title: Biodiversity survey of Rugezi wetland, Year 2013

abstract.para: This data was generated from a project ARCOS in the partnership with the Kitabi College of Conservation and Environment Management (KCCEM), the Endangered Wildlife Trust (EWT) and the International Crane Foundation (ICF) with funding support from the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation. The project aimed at, among others, assessing the status of the Grey Crowned Crane in Rugezi Wetland (a highland wetland in North_Western Rwanda) as well as propose and pilot solutions to address threats affecting this species.

intellectualRights.para: To the extent possible under law, the publisher has waived all rights to these data and has dedicated them to the Public Domain (CC0 1.0). Users may copy, modify, distribute and use the work, including for commercial purposes, without restriction.

project.title: Building community and national partnersâ€™ capacity for sustainable conservation financing at Rugezi Marsh, Rwanda

abstract.para: This project was implemented by the Global Crane Foundation-Endangered Wildlife Trust (GCF-EWT)Trust jointly with ARCOS and the Kitabi College of Conservationa and Environmental Management (KCCEM). Its objective was to reduce pressure (encroachment and overharvesting of plants) on the Rugezi Marsh by promoting alternative livelihood options and to assess the status of the Grey Crowned Crane species in the marsh.

funding.para: The project was funded by the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation

gbif.citation: Gashakamba F (2014): Biodiversity survey of Rugezi wetland, Year 2013. v1.1. Albertine Rift Conservation Society (ARCOS). Dataset/Occurrence. http://arbmis.arcosnetwork.org/ipt/resource?r=Rugezi_GCC_ARCOS_2013&v=1.1
